dfms 0.1.1

DFM Summary Methods

Source: R/methods.R
summary.dfm.Rd

Summary and print methods for class 'dfm'. print.dfm just prints basic model information and the factor transition matrix [A], summary.dfm returns all system matrices and additional residual and goodness of fit statistics - with a print method allowing full or compact printout.

# S3 method for dfm
print(x, digits = 4L, ...)

# S3 method for dfm
summary(object, method = switch(object$em.method, none = "2s", "qml"), ...)

# S3 method for dfm_summary
print(x, digits = 4L, compact = sum(x$info["n"] > 15, x$info["n"] > 40), ...)

Arguments

x, object

an object class 'dfm'.

digits

integer. The number of digits to print out.

...

not used.

method

character. The factor estimates to use: one of "qml", "2s" or "pca".

compact

integer. Display a more compact printout: 0 prints everything, 1 omits the observation matrix [C] and covariance matrix [R], and 2 omits all disaggregated information - yielding a summary of only the factor estimates.

Value

Summary information following a dynamic factor model estimation.

Examples

mod = DFM(diff(BM14_Q), 2, 3)
#> Converged after 26 iterations.
print(mod)
#> Dynamic Factor Model: n = 9, T = 117, r = 2, p = 3, %NA = 7.5973
#> 
#> Factor Transition Matrix [A]
#>      L1.f1  L1.f2  L2.f1   L2.f2   L3.f1  L3.f2
#> f1  0.6426 0.5214 0.6945 -1.8621 -0.6978 1.1665
#> f2 -0.2663 1.0482 0.4616 -0.8371 -0.4214 0.4514
summary(mod)
#> Dynamic Factor Model: n = 9, T = 117, r = 2, p = 3, %NA = 7.5973
#> 
#> Call:  DFM(X = diff(BM14_Q), r = 2, p = 3)
#>

#>

#>      L1.f1  L1.f2  L2.f1   L2.f2   L3.f1  L3.f2
